pages.text: Callawayia is a genus of Merriamosaur Ichthyosaur from the Upper Triassic of Canada. Originally described as a species of Shastasaurus back in 1994, the animal would remain inside the genus for 6 years before being renamed as Callawyia by Maisch and Matzke. The animal measured around 2.5 m long, however the specimens are also regarded as potentially young, with some authors projecting size estimates up to not much less than 6 m in length.

Something of interest about the animal's anatomy is how close it was to its  Jurassic relatives in the group, making the animal a bridge between the more basal Triassic forms and the thunnid ichthyosaurs of the later Mesozoic. The genus name was given in honor of Ichthyosaur researcher Jack Callaway, while the species name neoscapularis was given in reference to the shoulder blade anatomy being closer to Jurassic forms than its contemporaries.
